Key Match Events: India won the match by 24 runs
India's Arshdeep Singh has been their highest wicket-taker in this World Cup with 12 strikes at the rate of one every 10 balls
Pre-Game Insights: Australia will be on wafer-thin ice if they lose
India's net run rate gives them a decent safety net, but there is still a chance they could lose out on a semi-finals slot
Mitchell Marsh has struggled to find his form in the World Cup, scoring just 88 runs in six innings
Arshdeep Singh has been India's highest wicket-taker in this World Cup, but has also been inconsistent with his lengths at times
Australia may choose to leave out Mitchell Starc and bring in Ashton Agar
India may choose to bowl spin to Kohli and Rohit in the powerplay
Glenn Maxwell could be a useful option for Australia to bowl spin to Kohli and Rohit in the powerplay
Post-Match Reflections: India captain Rohit Sharma on the team's approach with the bat: "In T20s, I don't believe you need to get fifties and hundreds. How you can put pressure on the opposition is what matters. All the batters were trying to do that from the word go. That's how we want to play and encourage ourselves to go forward."
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played in St Lucia, which has been the most batting-friendly venue of this T20 World Cup in terms of both scoring rate (8.92) and average (28.76)
There is a good chance of rain in St Lucia, with forecasts predicting showers through Monday morning with the weather clearing up roughly between 10am and 4pm
Others: Virat Kohli (4103) and Rohit Sharma (4073) are separated by just 30 runs on top of India's run-scoring leaderboard in T20Is
If they both feature, Agar and Arshdeep will play their 50th T20Is
